Director, Laboratory for Language and Media Processing

As a Program Manager in the Information Innovation Office (I2O), I have a portfolio of language and vision related programs, including the recently transitioned Visual Media Reasoning (VMR) program, the Robust Automatic Transcription of Speech (RATS) program, and Media Forensics (MediFor) program.

I focus on modeling human interaction dynamics with stochastic process theory through combining the power of "big data" and the logic/reasoning power of state-of-the-art agent-based models, to solve our societies most challenging problems such as transportation sustainability and efficiency.

My approach is to drive “simulation games” (alike SimCity) with petabyte-sized “data exhaust trails” of networked people to study our social systems and make decisions through playing the data-driven simulation games on super-computers (which solve the stochastic differential equations that describe the agent behavior).
Developed proof-of-concept on big-data analytics infrastructure. Work won best implementation award of Cisco Innovation Day.

Developed a stochastic process solution to estimate epidemic spreading at individual level through combining data collected with personal mobiles phones and the susceptible-infectious-susceptible epidemics model. Work on the best paper award of the 2012 conference on Social computing, Behavior-cultural modeling and Prediction.
Developed and successfully applied a stochastic process framework

* to interpret the movement of one thousand to one million vehicles in San Francisco, Costa Rica, and Japan (tracked every minute for years) with a transportation forecasting model. This approach predicts short-term traffic 15% better than Google Traffic, and also predicts socio-economic trends. It was recognized with a presidential award from a major automobile manufacturer in Asia.

Experience: After starting a research career in network security, I discovered that most of my research revolved around data management.  Taking up the database mantle full time, I've done research on on technologies including gossip-protocols, probabilistic databases, query optimization, and distributed query processing.

As part of a collaboration between a Microsoft product group and MSR, I built a framework for constructing and simulating business scenarios.  This framework was optimized for doing parameter optimization over business scenarios, and was the basis for our SIGMOD 2011 paper.

I worked on techniques for constructing predictive models for display advertising.  My contribution consisted of several improvements to a compressed encoding for solutions to a high-dimensional quadratic optimization problem.  This work was included as part of our ICORES 2012 paper.

I am a professor in the department of Computer Science and Engineering.  My research focuses on text and social media mining, which brings together the disciplines of computational linguistics, information retrieval and machine learning.  My research group uses data science methodology to develop innovative solutions to problems involving multilingual social media and other data.  I teach graduate courses and seminars in information retrieval,  text/web mining, recommendation systems and behaviour analytics.

PeaceTech Lab is a non-profit housed in the United States Institute of Peace.  PeaceTech focuses on the use of data, technology and media for peacebuilding.  I direct the data related efforts at PeaceTech, including the groundTruth platform - a SaaS solution for early warning of social and economic disruption in emerging countries.  groundTruth leverages diverse data sources (including locally sourced data), machine learning and human expertise in conflict reduction.

Rohini served at Smartfocus as Chief Scientist.  She led a team in building context-aware marketing/messaging solutions that incorporate multiple sources of digital information such as customer data, social media, beacons, etc. - the Internet of Everything.  The solutions incorporate technologies in natural language processing, data mining and machine learning, her areas of expertise.

Content Savvy provides comprehensive content enrichment and analytics capabilities  for various industries, including healthcare, customer service and support, marketing, financial services.  Solutions are delivered through ContentSeer, a SaaS platform incorporating breakthrough multilingual semantic analysis technology.
